Class Scroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scroller
  • public class Scroller
extends Object
    CLASS: Scroller (extends Object) AUTHOR: danpost (greenfoot.org username) DATE: November 11, 2016 MODIFIED: December 22, 2016 (fixed 'scroll' method for limited no-image scrolling) MODIFIED: February 21, 2017 (fixed scroll offsets for unlimited no-image scrolling) DESCRIPTION: This is a support class for a scrolling world. It contains two constructors; one for unlimited scrolling and one for limited scrolling. Both constructors have an 'image' parameter. Because image manipulation can hog up CPU time, it is important to remember that it is better not to have a scrolling background image (having an Actor for the background is probably worse than having the background scroll). For unlimited scrolling using a background image, the smaller that background image to be tiled, the better. Making the viewport (the size of the world that is visible) smaller can help in CPU expense, also. Scrolling worlds should be unbounded, allowing actors to move beyond the visible area. Ensuring that actors are removed from the world if no longer needed when out of view will help to prevent lag, as well. It is the responsibility of the World object that creates a Scroller object to determine when to scroll and by how much.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Scroller​(greenfoot.World viewWorld, greenfoot.GreenfootImage image)
      This constructor is for an unlimited scrolling world; If 'image' is null, the background will not change; else the given image is wrapped
      Scroller​(greenfoot.World viewWorld, greenfoot.GreenfootImage image, int wide, int high)
      This constructor is for a limited scrolling world; If 'image' is smaller than the given total scrolling area, it will be tiled If 'image' is null, the background will not change

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getScrolledX()
      getter method for the current total scrolled distance horizontally
      int getScrolledY()
      getter method for the current total scrolled distance vertically
      void scroll​(int dsx, int dsy)
      performs scrolling on 'world' by the given distances along the horizontal and vertical; if 'limited' is false, requested distances are actual scrolling distances; if 'limited' is true, the distances may be adjusted due to the limits of scrolling

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scroller

        public Scroller​(greenfoot.World viewWorld,
                greenfoot.GreenfootImage image)
        This constructor is for an unlimited scrolling world; If 'image' is null, the background will not change; else the given image is wrapped
        Parameters:
        viewWorld - the world that scrolling will be performed on
        image - the background image that will be tiled, if needed, and wrap with scrolling

      • Scroller

        public Scroller​(greenfoot.World viewWorld,
                greenfoot.GreenfootImage image,
                int wide,
                int high)
        This constructor is for a limited scrolling world; If 'image' is smaller than the given total scrolling area, it will be tiled If 'image' is null, the background will not change
        Parameters:
        viewWorld - the world that scrolling will be performed on
        image - the background image that will be tiled, if needed, to fill the scrolling area
        wide - the width of the visible area encompassed through scrolling; the given value must be at least equal to the width of 'viewWorld' and is given in world cells (not in pixels)
        high - the height of the visible area encompassed through scrolling; the given value must be at least equal to the height of 'viewWorld' and is given in world cells (not in pixels)

    • Method Detail

      • scroll

        public void scroll​(int dsx,
                   int dsy)
        performs scrolling on 'world' by the given distances along the horizontal and vertical; if 'limited' is false, requested distances are actual scrolling distances; if 'limited' is true, the distances may be adjusted due to the limits of scrolling
        Parameters:
        dsx - the requested distance to shift everything horizontally
        dsy - the requested distance to shift everything vertically

      • getScrolledX

        public int getScrolledX()
        getter method for the current total scrolled distance horizontally
        Returns:
        the current total offset of horizontal scrolling

      • getScrolledY

        public int getScrolledY()
        getter method for the current total scrolled distance vertically
        Returns:
        the current total offset of vertical scrolling
